comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Possibly the daughter of Mrs. William Burgoyne Haight That Dorothy Haight was a debutante in November 1914 according to the New-York tribune., November 19, 1914, Page 7, column 7 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030214/1914-11-19/ed-... She was engaged in 1930, according to NYT of May 6, 1930 (needs subscription) select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FA0D14F73C5C157A... DOROTHY B. HAIGHT ENGAGED TO MARRY; Writer, a Member of the Junior League, to Wed Lewis Wilmot-Johnson. FIANCE SERVED IN THE WAR He Is the Son of Mrs. Edward H. Packe and a Captain in Reserve of British Army. The announcement has a picture which is compatible with this one. According to NYT of March 10, 1937, the couple were divorced on March1, 1937 in Carson City, Nevada. They had one child.
